badge_template_activities.title: Earning Criteria
Must be a Kyndryl employee
The badge applicant is required to mention the names of at least three mentees, and attach their email confirmations for having had a valuable mentoring relationship.
Must have mentored at least three mentees; with each mentoring relationship having completed a period of at least three months
Must have successfully performed mentoring activities from which the mentee gained benefits and career development support
Each mentoring relationship must have had at least 3 one-on-one connections, working to develop the area of interest of the mentees: career progression, certification, networking, socialization etc.
Apply for this badge. Your application will be reviewed by your manager.
Revalidation: This badge is valid for 2 years. After this period you will need to apply for revalidation. To revalidate your badge, you must have mentored at least 1 Kyndryl in the past 2 years.

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a Kyndryl employee.

Must have been recognized as a speaker/instructor meeting at least 1 of the following criteria on at least 3 different engagements (opportunities) in the past two years: 1. Kyndryl hosted conference for clients and/or partners 2. Third-party hosted industry or technical events 3. Client hosted event
4. Kyndryl knowledge sharing forums for employees (such as webinars) 5. Delivered an official learning workshop as part of the Kyndryl Learning curriculum(s) 6. Internal Kyndryl trainings

Presentation must have been to large groups (15+ for internal events and 50+ for third-party-hosted industry events) with prepared materials, adapting the materials to the audience .) Content delivered must be relevant to Kyndryl business or employee development
The delivery time should be at least 30 minutes. The total prep and delivery time should be at least 5 hours
At least 2 different topics must have been presented in the course of 3 different speaking engagements

To earn the badge, you must present the following event details for every one of the 3 engagements: o Event Title: o Event Duration: o Delivery date: o Amount of time preparing content: o Number of attendees: o Content description: o Skills transferred: o class NPS or satisfaction survey as well as any feedback to illustrate your recognition as an SME in the subject and the successful transferring of knowledge to attendees
Apply here

The badge will be valid for 2 years. To revalidate your skills as a speaker/instructor, you must provide evidence of completing at least 2 speaking engagements in the past 2 years. You can apply for the recertification badge on the below link.

If you have earned an IBM Recognized Speaker/Presenter Badge that is either still active or has expired on or after September 1, 2021 you can apply for recertification on the below link. If it has expired before above date you need to earn the Kyndryl Recognized Speaker/Instructor Badge.

badge_template_activities.title: ALPS Profile - All Partners are required to have a profile in the Account Leadership Pipeline System (ALPS)

Experience - Two years of experience is required to earn this badge. Provide the date assigned as a Partner, Delivery or Senior Partner, Delivery. (Other Partner roles do not apply.) The two years must be within the past 3 years, otherwise the skills will not be a match to the current version of certification.

Customized Education Roadmap - Fill in a survey to provide information regarding past education completed, past roles that led to the Partner role, and other badges earned so that credit can be given and a customized education roadmap can be designed. Finish the education prior to submitting the badge application.

Submit a Certification Package - Write your certification package by answering the questions in a template. Questions must be answered completely and provide insights into your skills and knowledge so that the board members who get assigned to interview you can use them to formulate additional questions.

Set up 3 interviews - You will be provided with the names and emails of 3 board members. You will set up one hour meetings with each one separately so they can interview you and make their decision regarding your certification. Each interviewer will provide an approve or decline vote. Approvals will automatically issue a badge. Declines will initiate a gap analysis with feedback to the candidate for improvement.
Apply for the certification

Experience - Three years of experience is required to earn this badge. Provide the date assigned as a Partner, Delivery. (Other Partner roles do not apply.) The three years must be within the past four years, otherwise the skills will not be a match to the current version of certification.

Fill in a survey to provide information regarding past education completed, past roles that led to the Partner role, and other badges earned so that credit can be given and a customized education roadmap can be designed. Finish the education prior to submitting the badge application.

Submit a package - Write your certification package by answering the questions in a template within the application. Questions must be answered completely and provide insights into your skills and knowledge so that the board members who get assigned to interview you can use them to formulate additional questions.

You will be provided with the names and emails of 3 board members. You will set up one hour meetings with each one separately so they can interview you and make their decision regarding your certification. After the interviews the Board members will vote to approve or decline. Approvals will result in the badge being issued. Declines will result in a gap analysis provided to the applicant for improvement.
Apply for the certification

Continual Improvement Cycle

Key Principles of Kyndryl Change Management: Change management is an IT practice designed to minimize disruptions to IT services while making changes to critical systems and services. A change is adding, modifying, or removing anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services. By completing this course, you will be able to: - List the 9 Key Principles of Change Management at Kyndryl - Exercise your Change Management knowledge by exploring real-situation scenarios
Key Principles of Kyndryl Change Management

Kyndryl Global Change Management Education Process Activities: This course covers the activities in all phases of change management, from requests for changes, to coordinating and testing changes, to reviewing and closing changes. Kyndryl Global Change Management Education Process Activities

3030e690-ad5d-444a-a027-9bae29b379f9.description: TSM Certification is intended to establish a standard of professional excellence and it distinguishes those professionals with the widest breadth and the deepest level of proven skills and expertise. It provides client-based certification of knowledge, demonstrated ability, level of experience, and an established record of success in Kyndryl services engagements. It ensures that each engagement is delivered with the same degree of skill and professionalism, by a team speaking with one voice.
3030e690-ad5d-444a-a027-9bae29b379f9.name: Certified Senior Consulting TSM

issuer.summary: issued by Kyndryl

badge_template_activities.title: If not previously certified have a minimum of 5 completed engagements, 2 of which must have a TCV of $75M or more. If previously certified have a minimum of 2 additional (beyond original certification engagements) completed engagements, 1 of which must have a TCV of $75M or more.
Complete at least 2 engagement with Hyperscaler content.

Selling Capability level Achieved is Experienced. If not previously certified win at least 2 engagement with a TCV of $75M or more as the Lead TSM. If previously certified win at least 1 engagement with a TCV of $75M or more as the Lead TSM.
Complete at least 1 engagement with competition engaged.
Lead at least 1 engagement with a consultant involved.
Obtain an Endorsement Letter from an Engagement Lead (i.e. CSE, CPE), Country SSM Leader or Country Solutions Executive, VP/Director/GM Sales and CTL/DE/TSE.
Complete all of the current Global Solutions required education.

The candidate must provide evidence about how they committed at least 120 hours of time and effort to develop talent and capabilities across the TSM Profession and how they set examples through their own personal growth and development, as well as by coaching and mentoring others. "Giveback" activity takes place in addition to the primary job mission of the candidate, and brings value to Kyndryl and the profession.
Applicant must be a TSM in a Band 10 or higher job role.
Consulting Experience - Lead at least 1 engagement with a consultant involved.
Consulting Capability level Achieved is Experienced.
Apply for the certification

5b32faf8-e8eb-4b81-a212-e04079b946be.description: This badge represents skills successfully acquired and expertise applied in a customer project involving a Kyndryl and Microsoft solution. The earner of this badge is able to comfortably talk about the subject and how the acquired knowledge supported a successful customer sale or implementation. Customer referrals, Microsoft advanced certifications, Microsoft cross pillar knowledge and success stories around Kyndryl and Microsoft solutions/offerings are evidences required to earn it.
5b32faf8-e8eb-4b81-a212-e04079b946be.name: KUfM Experienced Professional

issuer.summary: issued by Kyndryl

badge_template_activities.title: Evidence expertise through customer referrals. Each referral values 1 point. Submission includes the evidence through customer email, customer sat survey/NPS or Technical Leader/DPE testimonial happened within the last 12 months. Evidence should also state the project/work done, time period and how the candidate expertise contributed to the project (customer email should refer the project or work done by candidate)

Each valid/non expired Microsoft Advanced certification values 1 point. Evidence is the certification screenshot of a valid (non expired/non retired) certification or the Microsoft Transcript (a personal document generated from the Microsoft Learning dashboard). All Microsoft education is available at no cost in Microsoft ESI Portal, including certifications.
Earn Microsoft non Fundamental certifications

Microsoft Cloud has 5 pillars: Azure, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365 Power Platform and Security,Compliance and Identity. To be certified in more than one pillar support knowledge broadness, required to succeed in Cloud business. Having more than one active/non expired Microsoft certification in 2 or more pillars values 1 point. Fundamental and Advanced certifications are valid. All Microsoft education are available at no cost for Kyndryl in Microsoft ESI Portal, including the certifications.
Acquire Microsoft knowledge in multiple technology pillars

KUfM will recognize expertise, achieved through knowledge acquisition. It's important to describe a project sold or implemented where skills or expertise was key for success. Evidence must include Solution description containing customer name, date of deal closing or implementation finish, and solution description stating Microsoft components, Kyndryl services and why skills or expertise helped Kyndryl to win the deal or have a successful implementation.

Help others succeed is an important step in building a career and a learning opportunity itself. Giveback will be measured leveraging the Kyndryl Mentor badge or Kyndryl Speaker/Instructor badge. Evidence includes the Credly badge transcript or the URL or a MCT certificate. Link to Mentor Badge: https://kyndryl.biz/MentorBadge // Link to Speaker/Instructor badge: https://kyndryl.biz/Speaker_InstructorBadge

Each one of the criteria will grant one point and the candidate must earn a minimum of 4 points being at least one point for Solution selling/implementation and 1 point related to active/non expired certifications (either advanced Microsoft certifications or Microsoft cross pillar certifications)
Apply for this badge here

This badge is valid for 2 years from the achievement date. After that period, if you want to keep your certification, please apply for the recertification badge on the below-mentioned link. Once renewed, your current badge will have the expiration date extended.
Apply for recertication

Learning from Incidents

Problem Management Process
Problem Management Policies

Enter three high quality Complex Problem RCAs into the Digital RCA tool, and once submitted, share the RCA numbers (PRBEUxxxxxxx) into the input fields in the Badge application form. These should be real-life investigations from your account. The quality of the RCAs will be reviewed by Global Problem Management Process Owner based on Quality Scoring Grid. Your adherence to the content of the provided self-study materials will be taken into account as well.
Digital RCA SharePoint site

Document a real-life Proactive Problem Investigation from your account. Elaborate on what technique(s) you used to pinpoint the Proactive Problem (Pareto? ticket dumps? other?), what was the Root Cause and what were the corrective/preventive actions put in place to mitigate the Problem. If you are unsure what to focus on, review specifically the "Ticket Data Analysis" section of the Problem Management Tips & Techniques self-study material. Provide Digital RCA reference to the resulting RCA.
